C++ - Introduction

Created:2018-01-13  Last modified:2019-11-29

  • Introduction
  • Compared with C
  • Primitive types and string

  1. Introduction

    http://www.cplusplus.com

    C++ was created by Bjarne Stroustrup in 1979 as an extension of C language. The goal was to provide high-level features to C.

    In 1998, C++ was standardized by ISO, known as C++98.

    1. C++98
    2. C++03
    3. C++11
    4. C++14
    5. C++17

    In addition to the above ISO standard, there are also vendor specific standards, which are usually extension on the existed standard. For example, gun++11.

    Implmementation

    C++ compiler has different implementation, Clang, GCC, MSVC. For example, MacOS has a clang + LLVM implementation, where clang is the frontend that compile C++ to LLVM Intermediate Representation.

    1. Apple Clang

      In addition to support C++, Clang can also compile C, Objective-C and Swift to the LLVM IR.

    2. GUN Compiler Collection - GCC

      GCC supports C, C++, Objective-C, Fortran, Ada, Go. GCC supports serveral IRs.

  2. Compared with C

    1. Pointer
    2. Struct (But C++ does not need typedef.)
    3. Overload: same function name with different argument types. (the signature of a function includes its name and argument types.)
